orchid.features: One of the largest flowering plant families with over 28,000 species. Known for exotic, intricate blooms that can last for months. Many varieties are epiphytic, growing on trees rather than in soil.

lily.origin: Northern Hemisphere in Asia, Europe, and North America
lily.features: Perennial flowering plants with large, prominent flowers, often fragrant. Many varieties including Easter lily, tiger lily, and Asiatic lily. Symbolize purity and rebirth.

lily of the valley.origin: Northern Hemisphere in Europe and Asia
lily of the valley.features: Woodland flowering plant with sweetly scented, bell-shaped white flowers on stems. Despite its beauty, the plant is highly poisonous. Often used in bridal bouquets and represents sweetness and return of happiness.

lotus flower.features: Aquatic perennial plant with beautiful flowers that emerge from muddy waters. Sacred in many Eastern religions, symbolizing purity, spiritual awakening, and rebirth. Flowers open in the morning and close at night.

tulip.features: Spring-blooming bulbous plant with cup-shaped colorful flowers. Associated with Netherlands but originated in Central Asia. Available in nearly every color except true blue.

sweet pea, pink.features: Climbing annual with fragrant, colorful flowers in shades of pink, purple, blue, and white. Sweet peas have delicate, ruffled blooms and tendrils that help them climb. Popular in cottage gardens and for cut flower arrangements due to their sweet fragrance and long vase life.

pink sweet pea.features: Climbing annual with fragrant, colorful flowers in shades of pink, purple, blue, and white. Sweet peas have delicate, ruffled blooms and tendrils that help them climb. Popular in cottage gardens and for cut flower arrangements due to their sweet fragrance and long vase life.

purple sweet pea.features: Climbing annual with fragrant, colorful flowers in shades of pink, purple, blue, and white. Sweet peas have delicate, ruffled blooms and tendrils that help them climb. Popular in cottage gardens and for cut flower arrangements due to their sweet fragrance and long vase life.

everlasting sweet pea.features: Perennial climbing vine with pink, purple, or white flowers. Unlike the annual sweet pea, it has no fragrance but is hardier and comes back year after year. Its tendrils help it climb to heights of 6-9 feet on trellises, fences, or other supports.
